_header: Whoso well thinks well may say
Title(s): Chateau d’Amour ; The Myrour of lewed men
_description: ‘The Myrour of lewed men’ (a translation of the Chateau d’Amour with a Prologue of 14 lines) — 1261 lines in couplets

BLEge927.First Lines:
WHo so wele thinkes wele may sayffor of gode thoghtes comes gode
                    dedes ay…
BLEge927.Last Lines:
…Thrugh his grace & mercy graunt vs that ioye to seNow
                    thre persones are all on god in trinite
BLEge927.Note:
Followed by a couplet stating: ‘A munk made this myror only for
                    lewed mennes sake / Thou that will se saule heke this thi myror thou take’
                    (f. 28).
